document.docAuthor: Volynkin, Anton V., Huang, Si-Yao & Dubatolov, Vladimir V.
document.masterDocTitle: A review of the Stigmatophora palmata (Moore, 1878) species-group (Lepidoptera Erebidae: Arctiinae) with description of a new species from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the Stigmatophora palmata (Moore, 1878) species-group (Lepidoptera Erebidae: Arctiinae) with description of a new species from China

subSubSection.paragraph:

, Sinozoologia 8: 377, 381, fig. 1 ( Type locality: [ China , Hainan Isl.] “ Hainan Province ”).

Diagnosis . The forewing length is 13–14 mm in males and 15.5–16.5 mm in females.
Stigmatophora hainanensis
is reminiscent of
S. palmata
but differs by the somewhat paler postmedial and subterminal areas of the forewing with the narrower longitudinal black streaks. The male genital capsules of the two species are very similar but the valva of
S. hainanensis
is somewhat narrower subbasally, more constricted medially and having a narrow rectangular tip (whereas that of
S. palmata
is broad and more or less rounded). Additionally, the distal saccular process of
S. hainanensis
is slightly more elongate, narrower and apically pointed than in
S. palmata
. The vesica of
S. hainanensis
is markedly broader than that of
S. palmata
and its subbasal cluster consists of fewer cornuti, the number of which varies from 1 to 4. In the female genitalia, the ductus bursae of
S. hainanensis
is more elongate and the corpus bursae is broader than those structures of
S. palmata
.
